column2: Story
set up initial code structure - IDFind as base with newest facetview as front end
a user should be able to search for scholarly funding opportunities
users should be able to create profiles
column15: rrz: prefers separate user/pass instead of login integration like OpenID

column2: library upgrade
column17: make sure no broken URL-s by manual testing

column2: a user should be able to submit info about a scholarly funding opportunity
a user should be able to submit information about funders
bug Richard for survey feedback wrt Postgrads from Gateway to Resarch project CL are doing
add licensing-notes.txt
column15: expplain why its ok to use stackoverflow code

column2: users should be able to see a javascript visualisation of the data (just 1x to start with)
users should be able to set up e-mail alerts based on their searches
column15: based either on a saved search or on a current search (perhaps have the "make this search into an e-mail alert" button simply on the search interface and for saved searches, execute them - which then allows the user to press the "make into alert" button)

column2: users should be able to save their searches
use WTForms (Flask-WTF) instead of current manual approach
column15:
better validation, more "declarative" feel to coding the forms instead of the code-absolutely-everything-manually current time-waster

needs integration tests set up for the refactoring task (see tasks)
column19: read docs @ http://pythonhosted.org/Flask-WTF/ (WTForms docs linked to from there)
column21: refactor current forms - don't change functionality, just code everything in WTForms
column23: test the hell out of it to check for regressions
column25: add new functionality such as actually validating user's input .. since this is too cumbersome with the current manual setup it's not being done much!

column2: application should be able to harvest funding opportunities data from e-mail lists that funders provide to actual scientists (so subscribe to the same lists, especially when they are digests)
column15:
But... consider the fact that the fact those sites are so diverse is actually a big problem (hard to create a "picture" of available funding, which is what all funders, "fundees" and the rest of the related industry would greatly benefit from, as well as gov't-s). So maybe write up and provide some feedback to funders instead of just working around the vastly different websites.

Also: rss, atom! EPSRC provides rss!

column2: tagging research as "potentially of interest to" users AND groups (e.g. research groups)
users should be able to specify whether they're part of an institution, department, research group etc.
column15: allow browsing of that and autocomplete in the "tag this as interesting for my group" field, but dont forget to give users the option to be excluded from such lists (so they wouldn't show up on the catalogue of all users within their uni, for example)

column2: responsive mobile web design (enhance Facetview)
bulk funding opportunity data import
column15: import from CSV first, think about other formats later (both Excel and Google will export to CSV

column2: harvesting research council funded grant data into the app (configurable crawler?)
column15: historic info - see if we could get the actual application forms / project proposals as well from the councils and link them up with this data

column2: RESTful API + tests + docs for it. JSON-only at first.
users should be able to export the results of their searches
column15:
CSV at first
ask users whether they want other formats later

column2: use appropriate category when flashing messages
column15:
right now they're just alerts - just pass in a second parameter like
flash('Welcome back', 'success') (or 'error)

most of these are currently in fundfind.web
